meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to lose confidence or hope.
meanings.sent1: Constant criticism demoralizes students and makes them feel discouraged.
meanings.sent2: Bullying can demoralize a person and make them doubt their abilities.
meanings.sent3: The never-ending rain demoralizes the picnic planners, but they won't give up.
meanings.sent4: The loss of their star player demoralizes the team, leaving them feeling defeated.
meanings.sent5: The haunting memories of war demoralize the veteran, making it hard to find peace.

meanings.definition: Undermine the confidence or morale of (a person or group).
meanings.sent1: Spreading rumors can demoralize friendships and create distrust.
meanings.sent2: Failure after failure can demoralize even the most determined individual.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten demoralizes the dog by stealing its toys.
meanings.sent4: The corrupt leader demoralizes the nation, causing unrest and dissatisfaction.
meanings.sent5: The constant noise pollution demoralizes the residents, affecting their well-being.
